block.p: Kristine Elizabeth Barton, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. James Newcomb Barton of New Canaan, Conn., and Kenneth Alan Fishman, a son of Mr. and Mrs. Alfred Fishman of Plainview, N.Y., were married Friday in Evanston, Ill. The Rev. Dr. Timothy Stevens, a Congregational minister, and Rabbi Pavel Slavensky officiated at the interdenominational ceremony at the Alice Millar Chapel of Northwestern University.

Mrs. Fishman, 26 years old, is the director of marketing for Compulit Inc., a litigation-support-services company, in Chicago. She graduated from Northwestern University. Her father is the director of general services for the Union Carbide Corporation in Danbury, Conn.

Kristine Elizabeth Barton, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. James Newcomb Barton of New Canaan, Conn., and Kenneth Alan Fishman, a son of Mr. and Mrs. Alfred Fishman of Plainview, N.Y., were married Friday in Evanston, Ill. The Rev. Dr. Timothy Stevens, a Congregational minister, and Rabbi Pavel Slavensky officiated at the interdenominational ceremony at the Alice Millar Chapel of Northwestern University.

Mrs. Fishman, 26 years old, is the director of marketing for Compulit Inc., a litigation-support-services company, in Chicago. She graduated from Northwestern University. Her father is the director of general services for the Union Carbide Corporation in Danbury, Conn.

Mr. Fishman, 32, is a senior manager at Andersen Consulting in Chicago. He graduated from Johns Hopkins University and received an M.B.A. from Northwestern University. His mother, Rita Fishman, is a senior personnel representative for the Doubleday Book and Music Club Inc. in New York. His father is a self-employed commercial graphics artist.
